How to Cite International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management in APA Format

Complete guide to citing International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management in APA 7th edition with examples, unique formatting requirements, and common issues specific to this source.

International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management presents unique citation challenges that require specific guidance beyond general source type rules. This page provides targeted help for finding citation information, handling International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management's particular format requirements, and avoiding common mistakes specific to this platform.

üîç Try It Out

Paste a citation to check its International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management formatting

Quick Reference: International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management Citations

Reference List Format:
Author, A. A., & Author, B. B. (Year). Title of article. Title of Journal, volume(issue), pages. https://doi.org/xxxxx

International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management-Specific Notes:
When citing articles from the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management in APA 7th edition, students should adhere to the standard guidelines for journal articles but must be aware of a few specific considerations that might apply to this journal. In general, APA format requires the author's last name followed by initials, the publication year in parentheses, the title of the article in sentence case, the journal name in title case and italics, the volume number in italics, the issue number in parentheses (if applicable), and the page range. For example: Smith, J. A. (2023). Title of the article. International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management, 35(4), 123-145.

A unique aspect of citing from the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management is ensuring the DOI, if available, is included at the end of the citation. In APA 7th edition, the DOI should be formatted as a URL: https://doi.org/xxxx. Unlike some journals that might have unique citation formats, this journal follows the standard APA rules, but students often overlook details such as the inclusion of all co-authors up to 20, before using an ellipsis for more than 20 authors. Each author's last name should be followed by their initials without any space in between, separated by commas.

Students often misunderstand the number of authors to list before using an ellipsis, which is particularly relevant when citing articles from journals with large collaborative authorship. Remember to list the first 19 authors, followed by an ellipsis, and then the final author's name if there are more than 20 authors. To avoid errors, always verify the most current guidelines on the journal‚Äôs website or the APA manual. Ensure accuracy by double-checking details like spelling, proper punctuation, and DOI formatting to maintain the credibility and professionalism of the citation.

In-Text Citation:
- Parenthetical: ([Author], [Year])
- Narrative: [Author] ([Year])

Key Points:
- Use Journal Article format with International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management specifics
- Locate citation info on International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management's website
- Handle International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management's unique formatting requirements

Where to Find Citation Information on International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management

To accurately cite articles from the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management (IJCHM), students need to navigate the journal's website effectively to gather specific citation information such as the author, publication date, article title, and URL/access information. Here is a detailed guide on how to locate each piece of information:

  1. Author Information: Once on the article's page within the IJCHM site, the author byline is typically located immediately below the article title. This section lists all contributing authors, usually in a clear, bold font to ensure easy visibility. For articles with multiple authors, they are usually separated by commas, and you should list them in the order they appear for citation purposes.

  2. Publication Date: The publication date is generally found beneath the author names or near the top of the page, close to the journal‚Äôs issue number or volume information. On the IJCHM's platform, this information might be presented in a format such as "Published: Month Day, Year" or simply "Publication date: Month Year."

  3. Article Title: The title of the article is prominently displayed at the top of the article page. It is typically in a larger font size compared to the rest of the text and centered for emphasis. Make sure to note the exact wording and punctuation of the title, as it should be replicated exactly in your citation.

  4. URL/Access Information: The URL, which is the direct link to the article, can be found in your browser‚Äôs address bar once you have navigated to the specific article page. It's essential to ensure you are on the correct page for the specific article you intend to cite, as each article has a unique URL. Copy the entire link for accurate citation.

  5. Additional Access Information: Sometimes, additional access details such as DOI (Digital Object Identifier) are provided, usually near the abstract or at the bottom of the page. This unique identifier is crucial for APA citations.

In summary, when navigating the IJCHM website, focus on these specific locations: look for the authors under the article title, find the publication date under the author names, note the exact article title at the top, and copy the URL from the address bar. The structured layout of the IJCHM site is designed to facilitate easy access to these key details, streamlining the citation process for students and researchers.

Step-by-Step: Creating Your International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management Citation

How to Create an APA Citation for the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management

Creating an APA citation for articles from the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management may seem challenging at first. However, by following these detailed steps, you will be able to create accurate citations easily.

What You Need

Before you begin the process, ensure you have the following items ready:

  1. Access to the article you want to cite.
  2. A notepad or document to write down your citation.
  3. A citation guide or access to the APA style manual (if needed).

Step-by-Step Instructions

  1. Locate the Article
    - Action: Go to the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management's website or use a database like Google Scholar or your institution's library.
    - Verification: Confirm that you have found the correct article by checking the title and authors.
    - Time Estimate: 5-10 minutes.
    - Tip for Efficiency: Use search filters to narrow down results, such as year or topic, to find the article more quickly.

  2. Identify the Authors
    - Action: Look for the names of the authors of the article. Typically, these are listed at the beginning of the article.
    - Verification: Ensure you have the full names, including initials for each author.
    - Time Estimate: 2-3 minutes.
    - Tip for Efficiency: If there are many authors, write down only the first six authors followed by "et al." for articles with more than six authors.

  3. Determine the Publication Year
    - Action: Find the year the article was published, which is usually near the title or in the header/footer of the article.
    - Verification: Double-check that you have the correct year, especially if the article has multiple publication dates (e.g., online first).
    - Time Estimate: 1-2 minutes.
    - Tip for Efficiency: Note the year alongside the authors for quick reference.

  4. Write the Title of the Article
    - Action: Read the article's title carefully. Make sure to note it exactly as it appears, including any subtitles.
    - Verification: Ensure the title is in sentence case, meaning only the first word and proper nouns are capitalized.
    - Time Estimate: 2-3 minutes.
    - Tip for Efficiency: Copy and paste the title into your notepad to avoid typos.

  5. Find the Journal Title and Volume Information
    - Action: Identify the full title of the journal, the volume number, and the issue number (if applicable). This information is usually at the top of the article or in the citation section.
    - Verification: Make sure you have the journal title in italics and the volume number as well. The issue number should be in parentheses immediately after the volume number.
    - Time Estimate: 3-5 minutes.
    - Tip for Efficiency: Familiarize yourself with the common format of journal citations to quickly identify where this information is located.

  6. Locate Page Numbers
    - Action: Check the article to find the page range it covers. This is typically listed at the beginning or end of the article.
    - Verification: Confirm that you have the correct starting and ending page numbers for the article.
    - Time Estimate: 2-3 minutes.
    - Tip for Efficiency: If the article is available in PDF format, you can view the page numbers at the bottom of the document.

  7. Find the DOI
    - Action: Look for the Digital Object Identifier (DOI). This is often found on the first page of the article or in the citation information provided by the publisher.
    - Verification: Ensure you have the full DOI link, which should start with "https://doi.org/" followed by a series of numbers and letters.
    - Time Estimate: 1-3 minutes.
    - Tip for Efficiency: If the DOI is not visible, you can search for the article title in a search engine to find it.

  8. Compile Your Citation
    - Action: Using the information you have gathered, format your citation according to the APA template:
    - Example: Author, A. A., & Author, B. B. (Year). Title of article. Title of Journal, volume(issue), pages. https://doi.org/xxxxx
    - Verification: Double-check each component to ensure accuracy and adherence to APA formatting rules.
    - Time Estimate: 5-10 minutes.
    - Tip for Efficiency: Keep a template handy for future citations, so you can quickly

Real Examples from International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management

This section provides authentic citation examples from International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management using recent publications from 2023-2024.

I‚Äôm unable to browse the internet or access real-time content, so I can‚Äôt provide specific articles from 2023-2024 from the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management. However, I can guide you on how to properly format APA citations using hypothetical but realistic examples. When accessing real articles, ensure to replace the placeholders with the actual information.

Example 1: Standard Individual Author

  1. Scenario Description: This is a standard research article authored by a single researcher discussing sustainable practices in hospitality management.

  2. Reference List Citation:
    Smith, J. A. (2023). Sustainable practices in the hospitality industry: A comprehensive review. *International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management, 35*(2), 123-145. https://doi.org/10.1108/IJCHM-01-2023-0001

  3. In-text Citation (Parenthetical Format):
    - (Smith, 2023)

  4. In-text Citation (Narrative Format):
    - Smith (2023) discusses sustainable practices in the hospitality industry.

  5. Notes: This example is noteworthy for its focus on sustainability, a growing concern in the hospitality industry. It highlights the importance of individual contributions to academic literature.

Example 2: Corporate Author

  1. Scenario Description: This article is authored by a corporate entity, examining trends in digital transformation within hospitality businesses.

  2. Reference List Citation:
    Hospitality Research Group. (2023). Digital transformation in hospitality: Emerging trends and strategies. *International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management, 35*(3), 200-220. https://doi.org/10.1108/IJCHM-02-2023-0012

  3. In-text Citation (Parenthetical Format):
    - (Hospitality Research Group, 2023)

  4. In-text Citation (Narrative Format):
    - According to the Hospitality Research Group (2023), digital transformation is reshaping the hospitality industry.

  5. Notes: Corporate authorship underscores the collective expertise and research from organizations, offering a different perspective compared to individual researchers.

Example 3: Multiple Authors

  1. Scenario Description: This is a collaborative article by multiple authors exploring the impact of social media on hospitality marketing strategies.

  2. Reference List Citation:
    Johnson, L. M., Wong, P. T., & Garcia, R. A. (2024). The role of social media in modern hospitality marketing strategies. *International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management, 36*(1), 45-67. https://doi.org/10.1108/IJCHM-03-2024-0023

  3. In-text Citation (Parenthetical Format):
    - (Johnson, Wong, & Garcia, 2024)

  4. In-text Citation (Narrative Format):
    - Johnson, Wong, and Garcia (2024) explore how social media influences marketing strategies in hospitality.

  5. Notes: Multi-author works often provide diverse insights and comprehensive analyses, showcasing the benefits of collaborative research.

Example 4: Special Formatting Case

  1. Scenario Description: A special issue article that addresses the effects of global events on hospitality management.

  2. Reference List Citation:
    Lee, S. H., & Patel, D. R. (2023). Navigating global challenges: The case of hospitality management during pandemics. *International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management, 35*(S1), 300-320. https://doi.org/10.1108/IJCHM-S1-2023-0034

  3. In-text Citation (Parenthetical Format):
    - (Lee & Patel, 2023)

  4. In-text Citation (Narrative Format):
    - Lee and Patel (2023) discuss the challenges faced by hospitality management during global events.

  5. Notes: Special issues often focus on timely, significant topics, reflecting the journal‚Äôs effort to address pressing global challenges. The "S" in the issue number indicates a special issue, which is a unique formatting case.

When you access real articles, ensure to adjust the placeholders with accurate details from the articles you are citing.

Common Issues When Citing International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management

Problem 1: Identifying Authors

Issue Description:
Students often struggle to correctly identify authors when citing articles from the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management. This can lead to incorrect citations in their academic work.

Why It Happens:
The confusion often arises because the journal sometimes features articles with multiple authors, including corporate authors or collaborations between academia and industry. Additionally, author names might be listed in various formats, such as initials only or first and last names, which can be inconsistent across articles.

Solution Steps:
1. Locate the Author Section: On the journal's webpage for the specific article, look for the section usually placed at the top or bottom of the article, where author names are listed.
2. Check the Full Text: If the webpage is ambiguous, download the full article PDF, which often clearly lists all authors, including their full names and affiliations.
3. Use Author Order: Follow the order in which authors are presented. In APA, you should list authors in the same order as they appear in the publication.
4. Verify with ORCID or Author Profiles: If available, use ORCID IDs or institutional profiles linked in the article to confirm authors' full names.

Before Example:
Smith, J., & Doe, J. (2023).

After Example:
Smith, John, & Doe, Jane. (2023).

Problem 2: Date Formats

Issue Description:
Correctly formatting the publication date can be challenging, particularly when articles are published online first or have multiple publication dates.

Why It Happens:
The International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management may have an "Online First" date and an official publication date. Students often confuse these dates, using the incorrect one in citations.

Solution Steps:
1. Identify the Correct Date: Use the publication date that corresponds to the version of the article you accessed. For articles with both "Online First" and final publication dates, prefer the latter if available.
2. Check the PDF: The official publication date is often noted in the header or footer of the PDF version.
3. Use APA Format: Format the date as (Year, Month Day) only if the month and day are available; otherwise, use just the year.

Before Example:
(Online First: 2023)

After Example:
(2023)

Problem 3: URL Handling

Issue Description:
Including the correct URL in citations can be tricky due to the journal's use of DOI and accessibility through institutional databases.

Why It Happens:
Students may link directly to the journal's homepage or use URLs from database access points, which are often session-specific and not persistent.

Solution Steps:
1. Use DOI: Always prefer the DOI over a URL if available. It provides a permanent link to the content.
2. Retrieve DOI: Locate the DOI on the article's webpage or within the article PDF itself.
3. Format Correctly: In APA, format the DOI as a URL (e.g., https://doi.org/10.xxxx/xxxxx).

Before Example:
https://www.emerald.com/insight/journal/ijchm

After Example:
https://doi.org/10.xxxx/xxxxx

Problem 4: Access Requirements

Issue Description:
Students may have difficulty accessing articles, leading to incomplete citations.

Why It Happens:
The International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management is often accessed through institutional subscriptions or databases requiring specific login credentials.

Solution Steps:
1. Confirm Access: Ensure you have access through your academic institution or library. Use institutional logins where required.
2. Use Library Resources: Use your library's database portal to access full texts, ensuring you have all the necessary citation information.
3. Request if Unavailable: If you cannot access an article, request it through interlibrary loans or speak to a librarian.

By addressing these challenges specific to the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management, students can create accurate and reliable citations in their academic writing.

Note: For general Journal Article citation errors, see How to Cite Journal Article.

Frequently Asked Questions About International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management

Q: How can I find the necessary citation information for an article from the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management on its website?

A: To locate citation information on the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management's website, navigate to the article's page and look for sections like "Article Information" or "Citation." These sections typically include the authors, publication date, volume, issue, and DOI. If available, use tools like "Cite" or "Export Citation" for a pre-formatted APA reference.

Q: How should I handle articles from the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management that list corporate authors or multiple affiliations?

A: When citing an article with corporate authors, list the organization as the author in the reference. If the article includes authors with multiple affiliations, include only the names of the authors in the citation, as affiliations are not required in APA format.

Q: How do I correctly cite publication dates from the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management when only a year is provided?

A: In APA format, if only the year of publication is available, use just the year in the citation. For example: (Author, Year). If a more specific publication month or day is provided, include it in the format (Year, Month Day).

Q: What are the URL and access requirements for citing articles from the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management?

A: In APA 7th edition, include the DOI as a URL (https://doi.org/...) in the citation, if available. If there is no DOI, provide the homepage URL of the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management. Access dates are not required unless the content is likely to change over time.

Q: How does citing an article from the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management differ from other journal article sources in APA format?

A: Citing an article from the International Journal of Contemporary Hospitality Management generally follows the same APA guidelines as any other journal article, with the potential exception of unique author formats or specific publication details. Ensure that you include the DOI or URL and verify publication details directly from the journal's website for accuracy.
